title: Inconstistent indicators tests naming
body:
<!--- This template provides sections for bugs and features. Please delete any irrelevant sections before submitting -->

#### Expected Behavior
<!--- Required. Describe the behavior you expect to see for your case. -->

Indicators tests should have consistent names (ie using plural "Tests" when having several tests)

#### Actual Behavior
<!--- Required. Describe the actual behavior for your case. -->

```
Get-ChildItem -Path .\Tests\Indicators\ -Filter *Test.cs

    Directory: C:\Users\Admin\git\github\femto\Lean\Tests\Indicators

Mode                 LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                 -------------         ------ ----
-a---          07/07/2024    11:49           1339 ArnaudLegouxMovingAverageTest.cs
-a---          07/07/2024    11:49           3612 DerivativeOscillatorIndicatorTest.cs
-a---          07/07/2024    11:49           2121 DonchianChannelTest.cs
-a---          07/07/2024    11:49           1225 HullMovingAverageTest.cs
-a---          07/07/2024    11:49           4390 LeastSquaresMovingAverageTest.cs
-a---          07/07/2024    11:49           2057 OnBalanceVolumeTest.cs
-a---          07/07/2024    11:49           4063 RegressionChannelTest.cs
```

#### Potential Solution
<!--- Optional. Describe any potential solutions and/or thoughts as to what may be causing the difference between expected and actual behavior. -->

Rename files and change class names

#### Reproducing the Problem
<!--- Required for Bugs. Describe how to reproduce the problem. This can be via a failing unit test or a simplified algorithm that reliably demonstrates this issue.  -->

I'm using a PowerShell  function to edit new indicators files (using existing indicators).


```powershell
function Edit-Indicator-Files {
    param (
        $indicator
    )

    $test_file = ".\Tests\Indicators\" + $indicator + "Tests.cs"
    $impl_file = ".\Indicators\" + $indicator + ".cs"
    $copy_data = "Tests/QuantConnect.Tests.csproj"
    $register_indic = "Algorithm/QCAlgorithm.Indicators.cs"
    code $test_file $impl_file $copy_data $register_indic
}
```

I noticed this problem as I wanted to create `SFX` indicator using code from `DonchianChannel`

#### Checklist

- [x] I have completely filled out this template
- [x] I have confirmed that this issue exists on the current `master` branch
- [x] I have confirmed that this is not a duplicate issue by searching [issues](https://github.com/QuantConnect/Lean/issues)
<!--- Required for Bugs, feature request can delete the line below. -->
- [x] I have provided detailed steps to reproduce the issue
